text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Kuwait's press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Kuwait claims added compensation for environmental damages caused by the 1990-91 Iraqi occupation, raising the amount to $16.3 billion.
- Kuwaiti Emir Sheikh Jaber al-Ahmad al-Sabah says Kuwait is keen on implementing Sharia Islamic law.
- Kuwait Trade Ministry studying the establishment of firms to run real estate owned by the ministry.
- Kuwait Stock Exchange index on Saturday rose 11.1 points to 2,035.9.

- Kuwait says higher education undersecretary Rasha al-Sabah, a member of the ruling al-Sabah family, is one of five candidates nominated to the post of rector of the United Nations University. The post has the rank of U.N. assistant secretary-general.
- Emir says Kuwait is proud of its freedom of speech and constructive criticism. Kuwait is the only Gulf Arab state with an elected parliament.
- Parliamentry proposal to reduce sentences for prisoners not convicted in illicit drug and sexual abuse cases approved.
